boardgame.description: In Blood Bound, a deduction game played in 15-30 minutes, players assume the roles of members of two clans _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; the brutal, animalistic warriors of the Clan of the Beast and the graceful, deadly members of the Clan of the Rose _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; and (with an odd number of players) the human inquisition. Disguised by a secret identity, they try to kidnap the Elder of the opposing clan or give their lives for the benefit of their own Elder. Malicious attacks, aimed indiscretions, and assistance from others will slowly uncover the truth: Who fights for whom? And who is the Elder?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;At the start of the game, each player knows three things:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Who they are and to which clan they belong_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; That a few other players are allies, while everyone else is the enemy of both themselves and their clan_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The clan to which one of their neighbors belongs _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; although some characters can lie about their clan identity_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Now the players have to figure out who the Elder of the opposing team is (if there is one) and capture him. To do this, players need to attack, negotiate and deduce, with an attacked player being required to reveal information, such as his rank or clan affiliation. Each player has an ability unique to his character, and this ability can be used only at the moment that he reveals his rank. The Assassin forces players to suffer wounds, for example, while the Guardian protects a player of the character's choice._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the end, if you capture your rival clan's Elder, you win _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; but if you capture the wrong vampire, you've fallen into the enemy's trap and lose the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Fantasy Flight Games (FFGHB08) Blood Bound is a game of deduction, bluffing, and betrayal for six to twelve players. Each player belongs to one of two rival vampire clans, and fellow clan members must work together to capture the opposing clan_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s leader. The catch? Identities are hidden at the start of the game, disguising ally and enemy alike. By attacking other players and forcing them to reveal information about their identity, players must distinguish friend from foe, and root out the rival leader! Blood Bound provides a fun and fast-paced social experience. Unique abilities for each character ensure dynamic play scenarios. Ideal for larger gaming groups or parties, Blood Bound supports up to twelve players.
